t: Mark 15
And*p straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him to Pilate.
And*p Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering said unto him, Thou*r sayest*r it.*r
And*p the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.
And*p Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.
But*p Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.
Now*p at that feast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.
And*p there was one named Barabbas, which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him, who had committed murder in the insurrection.
And*p the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them.
But*p Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
For*p he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.
But*p the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.
And*p Pilate answered and said again unto them, What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?
And*p they cried out again, Crucify him.
Then*p Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, Crucify him.
And*p so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.
And*p the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.
And*p they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head,
And*p began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!
And*p they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.
And*p when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.
And*p they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.
And*p they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.
And*p they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.
And*p when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.
And*p it was the third hour, and they crucified him.
And*p the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
And*p with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.
And*p the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.
And*p they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,
Save*p thyself, and come down from the cross.
Likewise*p also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.
Let*p Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reviled him.
And*p when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
And*p at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi,*r Eloi,*r lama*r sabachthani?*r which is, being interpreted, My*r God,*r my*r God,*r why*r hast*r thou*r forsaken*r me?*r
And*p some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.
And*p one ran and filled a sponge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.
And*p Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
And*p the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.
And*p when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
There*p were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
(Who*p also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.
And*p now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
Joseph*p of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.
And*p Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.
And*p when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
And*p he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
And*p Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
